info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 11:23PM EDT until June 17 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...The following county, in central Ohio, Pickaway.
* WHEN...Until 115 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1123 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Ashville, South Bloomfield, New Holland, Commercial Point, Fox, Orient, Darbyville, Duvall, Derby, Deer Creek Lake and Slate Run Metro Park. - Heaviest rainfall has been from just east of Mt. Sterling to between Commercial Point and Ashville.
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT TUESDAY
